titleStmt.title: Controlled vocabulary for places in MedCyprus project, both monuments (churches) and repositories (museums)

desc.desc: 3rd layer: second half of the 15th century (western bay, north wall)

place.desc: Anchorite cell and burial place, pilgrimage

desc.desc: 1st layer: 10th century (nave, north wall, eastern side) Some of the paintings are held by the Byzantine Museum of the Cultural Foundation Archbishop Makarios III
3rd layer: 13th-14th c.? First half of the 14th c.? (bema, naos)

place.desc: Single-aisled vaulted church, with a later south chapel and narthex

desc.desc: 1st layer: late 12th century (naos, western section of south wall, west wall)

place.desc: Fragmentary. Some of the murals were illegally detached from the walls following 1974; current location unknown.
single-aisled barrel-vaulted church; narthex with drumless dome subsequently added to the west

desc.desc: 1st layer: early 13th century (nave, north and south wall)

place.desc: Partially preserved; after 1974, mutilated, some detached

desc.desc: first half of the 13th century (bema, naos)

place.desc: domed-hall church with a later extension to the west, built on the ruins of a 7th-century three-aisled basilica

desc.desc: 2nd layer: first half of the 16th century (bema, dome, naos)

desc.date: Prior to the late 12th century (date of 1st layer of painted decoration)

place.desc: Domed-hall structure, with an early 12th-13th c. narthex covered both with a large timber roof

desc.desc: 4th layer: First half 17th century(external north wall)

place.desc: 1st layer: Theodore Apseudes (?) or "Painter of Apseudes" 2nd layer: "Painter of Leo" 3rd layer: Leontios the Deacon

place.placeName: Monagri, Monastery of Panagia Amasgou, katholikon

place.desc: Single-aisled timber-roofed church with an L-shaped closed portico on its northern and western side.

desc.desc: 2nd layer: Early 14th century (nave: Presentation of Christ in the Temple, gallery: external west wall)
3rd layer: Late 15th - Early 16th century (gallery: external side of the northern wall)

place.desc: Ioannes Gerakiotes and his wife Irene

place.placeName: Νικητάρι, Παναγία ἡ Φορβιώτισσα ή τὴς Ἀσίνου
place.desc: Single barrel-vaulted church with a second timber gable roof and narthex

desc.desc: 2nd layer: Second half of the 12th century (narthex: south conch: Saint George)
3rd layer: Late 13th century (bema, nave, narthex: south conch: semidome, semicylindrical wall: St. Anastasia Pharmakolytria with the donor Anastasia Saramalina )
5th layer: First half of the 17th century (Christ Emmanuel: now in bema)
3rd layer: first half of 14th century (bema [now in south apse], nave)
4th layer: 3rd quarter of the 14th century (north aisle)
5th layer: 15th century (west wall of the south aisle)

place.desc: Single-aisled cross-in-square church with dome, on the ruins of an early Christian basilica

desc.desc: 3rd layer: Last third 13th century (bema [prothesis: disk with asterisk], naos)
4th layer: 16th century (bema [prothesis: figure in/and the chalice], naos: northeastern small recess)

place.placeName: Byzantine Museum of the Cultural Foundation Archbishop Makarios III
